oai_dc:dc.dc:title: KINETICS OF DIACETYLENE POLYMERIZATION - AN FT-RAMAN STUDY
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: KAMATH, M
KIM, WH
LI, L
KUMAR, J
TRIPATHY, S
BABU, KN
TALWAR, SS
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: solid-state polymerization
polydiacetylene
scattering
films
1,4-bis(3-quinolyl)-1,3-butadiyne
spectroscopy
dependence
crystal
spectra
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Changes in the FT-Raman spectrum of 1,4-bis(3-quinolyl)buta-1,3-diyne (DQ) as a function of gamma-ray dosage is used to monitor the degree of monomer to polymer conversion in a solid-state topochemical polymerization reaction. The relative intensities of the characteristic C=C peaks in the nonresonant FT-Raman spectra provide a nondestructive quantitative means to measure the conversion from monomer to polymer.
